posts.body: Fucking boomer lmao

>>705f9fcb-4146-42d0-b305-aa7dbcfbb476
Look on /tech/ some anon posted instructions for an update to new millchan.

>>0abe1b61-2754-42b9-b0c1-a5ead9df6cc9
I was hoping to stay. No reason to go back really.

>>9efe3377-1cf8-4889-a4ae-82ba299a9d0a
Yeah, where the fuck is he? Niggers' gone dark

>>66dc8213-8c26-4af3-bebb-ef1ebea657ea
Do a site backup, implement and see if anons start complaining. Pretty good litmus test if you ask me.
I feel imageboards belong on decentralized services. It's gonna take some work, but it's already miles ahead of early 8chan as I remember it.

We're gonna need some smart people to figure out the solution to the CP question. One large dump and many anons could have legal issues. Of course you can mute, but we're gonna need some heavy guns if/when the glows get angsty with their CP spam.

posts.subject: Posts deleted or blacklisted by mods should have content deleted.
posts.body:
First of all we're gonna need mod accounts(using a service like zeroID maybe). 
Then we'll need 08chan to automatically delete images from users that are banned/blacklisted.
This solves the legal issue, since moderators are now responsible for removal of illegal content, while still upholding the ability to self moderate.

Maybe it's even possible to implement some image hashing and automatic moderation in case of spam.

>>92f47b70-6dda-4588-92f4-8e8d699a6b3b
Yeah, I know. But the browser side software is able to delete files through the mute function. How about a distributed database managed by some trusted users? If enough of them mute someones ID it gets added to the mute db, and all anons that opted in will have the spammer muted automatically. This could even get expanded by an image hash db, that blocks users from sharing images it knows about. As far as I've read it is actually possible for a site owner to remove things and propagate the changes to users.

>>4cdcc7b5-c171-47db-9b88-d2b8bd8d7720
p2p is really bad for the Tor network. Which is why guardian nodes are banning us during high traffic.

>>e5420e6f-e205-4e26-8ad4-476d4cfe161e
Editing is pretty OP

>>9be65e39-2b42-44db-9fd6-2c1dea56bdb4
That's what I'm excited about. Imageboards are filled with many talented people, many whom have been banned from other platforms. The decentralized net kind of feels like the final evolution of the internet, a place where information flows completely freely and adults are allowed to think, talk and laugh. Like you said, it's impressive how well this actually works, even under a straining Tor network. Maybe zeronet just got a very needed injection of talented people that look to build a permanent home.
The ideal protocol for me would be something like
>Tor like protocol with onion routing
>All connected users are relays
>p2p
>Local storage is encrypted, decryption happens on content load or manually
>A cryptocurrency is awarded for harddrive space and bandwidth sharing
>This currency can be used on internal services or sold for dollars, to drive a psuedoeconomy and promote growth from greed
>First upload will break up your file and share it to many users for a much faster seed, they will then share their pieces with others that consolidate them.
>Lost files can be recovered if site user gets them from elsewhere

>>59ac0a84-43ee-4638-b93c-5ab6c953558c
That could get really ugly, really fast. Makes thread pruning a necessity, or maybe a script that checks hashes, deletes duplicates and replaces them with a symlink to the original?

>>5606dbca-3255-489a-a8cc-6bb188f5c00a
Why is the cookie not in /var/lib/tor?
Change your Tor config like the OP said, then try 
>stat -c%a /var/lib/tor
it should return 750, if not do
>sudo chmod 750 /var/lib/tor

>>b2e32952-74dd-42d0-8a54-d5c503549f1d
Did you install Tor with pacman? If that's the case there is some kind of bug, installed software should already have execute privileges. Pretty understandable that no one would have thought of that, its pretty unusual.

>>fb558011-8b35-47d1-9947-ff5bb0219b7a
Exactly what /pol/ is doing in the general populace right now. We spread information normalfags can use when society takes a turn for the worse. When the economy tanks, who is to blame? They will remember memes and videos they have seen and know that we where right. Comfy people are lazy and shortsighted.

>>de78694d-507d-49c2-b426-373f4e122920
Censorship? It would of course be opt-in like the blacklist. I just don't want to scour my seedbox for childporn everyday.

>>b514b5d1-7943-4360-bb46-377a6d4111c4
Tor guard nodes ban us since p2p is essentially DDoS'ing Tor. It's a pretty hacky solution but it's the best we have right now.

While the 08chan frontpage is open in a browser tab, my seed server sends around 25 megabits pr second to my pc. What the hell is going on here? Just look at the graph here, dip is when I close the frontpage tab.

>>ccfadaa9-98fd-4cbc-98ef-9a65aa0e12b0
Fucking thank god, even though boomers seeding the entire site could be useful.

>>21d21342-568f-494d-9c77-ce386e8f9642
How do i set it up in my torrc file? I added IsolateDestAddr next to the definition for the socks port. Tor is still complaining about overloaded guardian nodes

>>962f9a60-e499-4355-93d3-57913faee82c
So basically zeronet/Tor is completely useless?

>>e0aa23e9-b79c-453e-b3a0-40289df8b7c7
Hit me up on zeromail removeboomer@zeroid.bit
Tor is just not letting me seed properly
[code]lamo XD[/code]
If only we had a machine learning model that could detect CP, would make life a lot easier.
Welp, I guess it's gonna get shitty if captcha isn't implemented in the next couple of hours.

>>223dd8a9-ea66-4c06-9fae-a0308e806f6b
Okay admin before anything else, we need some kind of captcha. /pol/ is nuked

>>ff2cccf6-65d6-40cb-ad78-4774429a1ee6
rip

>>48a799ab-c997-4367-bc3c-a7b21d68d39c

>>65fb7596-03e6-4396-890b-f546527d8ce4

>>5958efac-5090-47de-9acb-9a9d3f5a2d1f
Captcha worked fine on 8

>>0d7898f4-81f6-424b-a92d-08bb1117905f
What about forcing users to use zeroid for posting?

>>9fb74cf1-7b9f-4918-9add-ecae9cd4f701
Only allow posting from zeroid ID's

>>2445e1e5-f4a6-4c89-b643-86da0feef356
>The easiest solution would be disabling self-signed certificates and only allowing ZeroID or any other trusted CA that cannot be auto-generated

THIS THIS THIS THIS

>>eaa583e6-6fdc-4031-86d1-89685cf7db94
>ZeroID is a centralized service, they can rate limit easily.

>>37ec7e27-ac09-4987-b51a-caf2cd1fdbcb
Problems get solved when they pop up, right now it's much more important to stop and autofilter spam than generate ID's. When centralized ID generation gets DDoS'd the tools to decentralize it will be written. We really need some real devs managing this site. I hope the admin merges us with main branch millchan soon, so we can look at the source and write tools.
